1123591854459707392.text:
Time to clear up some misconceptions around the nature of staking rewards:

https://medium.com/figment-networks/mis-understanding-yield-and-inflation-in-proof-of-stake-networks-6fea7e7c0e41 …

TLDR PoS networks do NOT have an Inflation Rate. Instead they have a Token Holder Dilution Rate.  They also do NOT have a Yield. Token holders receive a Share of Staking Rewards.

Decentralised oracles aim to bridge them whist minimising trust.

1084048630254850048.text:
PoS should have in protocol delegation to create non-custodial staking pools.

Pooling of funds will happen anyway due to economies of scale and ppl not owning min amounts to stake

There is counterparty risk without delegations, similarly to how it manifests in pooled PoW mining

Designing validator workflow and talking to @dannyryan clarified a few crucial ETH2.0 concepts for me. I thought I'd share.
In ETH2.0, each validator gets assigned to two types of committees. 1.) crosslink (or shard) committee  2.) persistent committees
